sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true character of sundry trades and callings: or, A new ditty of innocent mirth. This song is new, and perfect true, there's none can this deny; for I am known, friend, to be one that scorns to tell a lye. To the tune of, Old Simon the King. This may be printed, R.P.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner., [London] : [1685]
Verse: "Now gentlemen sit you all merry ..." Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======

Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner., [London] : [1685]
Verse: "Now gentlemen sit you all merry ..." Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.

the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.
